definition: to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
to confer a posthumous title
posthumous name and title
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
smiling face
variant of 諡|谥[shi4]
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
a rank in government service
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
to suspend business at the imperial court on account of a misfortune
state funeral
posthumous honorific name
sacrifice oneself for one's country/martyr
to hand down an imperial edict
to die for one's country

death of a prince/swarming
